hints.content:
This rectangle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $2$ pieces shaded.  

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. Two parts are shaded red.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/57d8e96e56dcced0061c2f4a994c4cd9006787a5)

The rectangle has **two thirds** of the shape shaded.

This rectangle is not split into equal-sized pieces.

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 unequal parts. The largest part is shaded purple.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b0c1b0782685779b2c7b84eb77d5e1d269461874)

This rectangle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $1$ piece shaded.  

![A rectangle has 2 horizontal lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. One part is shaded green.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/44f9a1cd19242b4240dc6975433a8470906a7b27)

The rectangle has **one third** of the shape shaded.

This rectangle is split into $3$ equal-sized pieces, or $\text{thirds}$, with $3$ piece shaded.  

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. Three parts are shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7ac9eca57676a775298749a450f8d486911ab418)

This rectangle has **three thirds** of the shape shaded.

This rectangle has **three thirds** of the shape shaded:

![A rectangle has 2 vertical lines dividing it into 3 equal parts. Three parts are shaded blue.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/7ac9eca57676a775298749a450f8d486911ab418)

question.content:
**Which rectangle shows three thirds of the shape shaded?**
